Neuropsychiatric Inventory - A. Delusions
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 1. Does {P} believe that he/she is in danger - that others are planning to hurt him/her?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 10a. Frequency Ratings
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 10b. Severity Ratings
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 10c. Caregiver Distress
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 2. Does {P} believe that others are stealing from him/her?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 3. Does {P} believe that his/her spouse is having an affair?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 4. Does {P} believe that unwelcome guests are living in his/her house?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 5. Does {P} believe that his/her spouse or others are not who they claim to be?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 6. Does {P} believe that his/her house is not his/her home?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 7. Does {P} believe that family members plan to abandon him/her?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 8. Does {P} believe that television or magazine figures are actually present in the home?  [Does he/she try to talk to or interact with them?]
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 9. Does {P} believe any other unusual things that I haven't asked about?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - A. Delusions: Item score
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - B.  Hallucinations
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 1. Does {P} describe hearing voices or act as if he/she hears voices?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 2. Does {P} talk to people who are not there?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 3. Does {P} describe seeing things not seen by others or behave as if he/she is seeing things not seen by others (people, animals, lights, etc.)?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 4. Does {P} report smelling odors not smelled by others?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 5. Does {P} describe feeling things on his/her skin or otherwise appear to be feeling things crawling or touching him/her?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 7. Does {P} describe any other unusual sensory experiences?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 8a.  Frequency Ratings
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 8b. Severity Ratings
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 8c. Caregiver Distress
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - B. Hallucinations: Item score
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - C: Agitation/Aggression
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 1. Does {P} get upset with those trying to care for him/her or resist activities such as bathing or changing clothes?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 2. Is {P} stubborn, having to have things his/her way?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 3. Is {P} uncooperative, resistive to help from others?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 4. Does {P} have any other behaviors that make him/her hard to handle?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 5. Does {P} shout or curse angrily?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 6. Does {P} slam doors, kick furniture, throw things?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 7. Does {P} attempt to hurt or hit others?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 8. Does {P} have any other aggressive or agitated behaviors?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 9a. Frequency Ratings
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 9b. Severity Ratings
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 9c. Caregiver Distress
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - C. Agitation/Aggression: Item score
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - D: Depression/Dysphoria
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 1. Does {P} have periods of tearfulness or sobbing that seem to indicate sadness?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 2. Does {P} say or act as if he/she is sad or low in spirits?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 3. Does {P} put him/herself down or say that he/she feels like a failure?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 4. Does {P} say that he/she is a bad person or deserves to be punished?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 5. Does {P} seem very discouraged or say that he/ she has not future?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 6. Does {P} say he/she is a burden to the family or that the family would be better off without him/her?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 7. Does {P} express a wish for death or talk about killing him/herself?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 8. Does {P} show any other signs of depression or sadness?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 9a. Frequency Ratings
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 9b. Severity Ratings
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 9c. Caregiver Distress
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - D. Depression/Dysphoria: Item score
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - E. Anxiety
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 1. Does {P} say that he/she is worried about planned events?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 2. Does {P} have periods of feeling shaky, unable to relax, or feeling excessively tense?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 3. Does {P} have periods of [or complain of] shortness of breath, gasping, or sighing for no apparent reason other than nervousness?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 4. Does {P} complain of butterflies in his/her stomach, or of racing or pounding of the heart in association with nervousness? [Symptoms not explained by ill health]?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 5. Does {P} avoid certain places or situations that make him.her more nervous such as riding in the car, meeting with friends, or being in crowds?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 6. Does {P} become nervous or upset when separated from you [or his/her caregiver]? [Does he/she cling to you to keep from being separated?]
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 7. Does {P} show any other signs of anxiety?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 8a. Frequency Ratings
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 8b. Severity Ratings
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 8c. Caregiver Distress
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - F. Elation/Euphoria
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 1. Does {P} appear to feel too good or too happy, different from his/her usual self?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 2. Does {P} find humor and laugh at things that others do not find funny?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 3. Does {P} seem to have a childish sense of humor with a tendency to giggle or laugh inappropriately (such as when something unfortunate happens to others)?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 4. Does {P} tell jokes or make remarks that have little humor for others but seem funny to him/her?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 5. Does he/she play childish pranks such as pinching or playing 'keep away' for the fun of it?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 6. Does {P} 'talk big' or claim to have more abilities or wealth than is true?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 7. Does {P} show any other signs of feeling too good or being too happy?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 8a. Frequency Ratings
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 8b. Severity Ratings
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - G. Apathy/Indifference
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 3. Is {P} less affectionate or lacking in emotions when compared to his/her usual self?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 4. Does {P} contribute less to household chores?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 5. Does {P} seem less interested in the activities and plans of others?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 7. Is {P} less enthusiastic about his/her usual interests?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 9a. Frequency Ratings
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 9b. Severity Ratings
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 9c. Caregiver Distress
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - G. Apathy/Indifference: Item score
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - H. Disinhibition
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 1. Does {P} act impulsively without appearing to consider the consequences?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 3. Does {P} say things to people that are insensitive or hurt their feelings?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 6. Does {P} take liberties or touch or hug others in a way that is out of character for him/her?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 8a. Frequency Ratings
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 8c. Caregiver Distress

Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 1. Does {P} have a bad temper, flying 'off the handle' easily over little things?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 2. Does {P} rapidly change moods from one to another, being fine one minute and angry the next?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 3. Does {P} have sudden flashes of anger?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 4. Is {P} impatient, having trouble coping with delays or waiting for planned activities?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 5. Is {P} cranky and irritable?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 6. Is {P} argumentative and difficult to get along with?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 7. Does {P} show any other signs of irritability?

Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 1. Does {P} have difficulty falling asleep?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 2. Does {P} get up during the night (do not count if the patient gets up once or twice per night only to go to the bathroom and falls back asleep immediately)?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 3. Does {P} wander, pace, or get involved in inappropriate activities at night?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 4. Does {P} awaken you during the night?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 5. Does {P} awaken at night, dress, and plan to go out thinking that it is morning and time to start the day?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 6. Does {P} awaken too early in the morning (earlier than was his/her habit)?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory - 7. Does {P} sleep excessively during the day?

Neuropsychiatric Inventory Q - Severity Ratings (C. Agitation/Aggression)
Neuropsychiatric Inventory Q - Does P act as if he/she is sad or in low spirits? Does he/she cry?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory Q - Severity Ratings (D. Depression/Dysphoria)

Neuropsychiatric Inventory Q - Does P become upset when separated from you? Does he/she have any other signs of nervousness, such as shortness of breath, sighing, being unable to relax, or feeling excessively tense?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory Q - Severity Ratings (E. Anxiety)
Neuropsychiatric Inventory Q - Does P appear to feel too good or act excessively happy?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory Q - Severity Ratings (F. Elation/Euphoria)
Neuropsychiatric Inventory Q - Does P seem less interested in his/her usual activities and in the activities and plans of others?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory Q - Severity Ratings (G. Apathy/Indifference)
Neuropsychiatric Inventory Q - Does P seem to act impulsively? For example, does P talk to strangers as if he/she knows them, or does P say things that may hurt people's feelings?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory Q - Severity Ratings (H. Disinhibition)
Neuropsychiatric Inventory Q - Is P impatient or cranky? Does he/she have difficulty coping with delays or waiting for planned activities?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory Q - Severity Ratings (I. Irritability/Lability)
Neuropsychiatric Inventory Q - Does P engage in repetitive activities, such as pacing around the house, handling buttons, wrapping strings, or doing other things repeatedly?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory Q - Severity Ratings (J. Aberrant Motor Behavior)
Neuropsychiatric Inventory Q - Does P awaken you during the night, rise too early in the morning, or take excessive naps during the day?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory Q - Severity Ratings (K. Sleep)
Neuropsychiatric Inventory Q - Has P lost or gained weight, or had a change in the food he/she likes?
Neuropsychiatric Inventory Q - Severity Ratings (L. Appetite)
Neuropsychiatric Inventory Q - Total score
